gurmukhi: kV`kwr qygM qV`kwr qIrM ] Bey tUk tUkM rxM bIr DIrM ]
transliteration: Kadakkaar Tegadg Tadakkaar Tderan|| Bhae Tooktookan Ranan Beer Dhderan||
translation: With the clattering of swords and the crackling noise of the arrows, the mighty and the enduring heroes were chopped into bits;

gurmukhi: bjy sMK qUrM su FolM FmMky ] rVM kMk bMky fhy bIr bMky ]32]
transliteration: Bade Sankh Tooran Su Dholan Dhamaooke|| Radan Kank Banke Dahe Beer Banke||32||
translation: The conches, clarionets and drums resounded and the wanton soldiers, riding on the sharp horses stood firmly in the battlefield.32.

gurmukhi: Bjy bwj gwjI ispwhI AnykM ] rhy TwF BUpwl Awgy n eykM ]
transliteration: Bhaje Baaj Gadjisipaahianekan|| Rahe Thaadh Bhoopaal Aage Na Ekan||
translation: Many a warrior riding on the horses and elephants fled away and none of the chiefs could stand against Narsingh.

gurmukhi: iPrXo isMG sUrM su kRUrM krwlM ] kMpweIstw pUC PyrI ibswlM ]33]
transliteration: Phiryo Singh Sooran Su Krooran|| Kanpaaeestaa Poochh Pheripheribisaalan||33||
translation: That terrible and dreadful Narsingh moved in the battlefield and began to stir his neck and wag his tail.33.

gurmukhi: grjq rx nr isMG ky B`jy sUr Anyk ] eyk itkXo ihrnwC qh Avru n joDw eyk ]34]
transliteration: Gadjat Ran Nar Singh Ke Bhajje Soor Anek|| Ek Tikyo Hirnaachh Tah Avar(u) Na Jodhaa Ek||34||
translation: Many warriors fled on the thunder of Narsingh and none could stand in battlefield except Hiranayakashipu.34.

gurmukhi: must ju`D ju`ty Bt doaU ] qIsr qwih n pyKIAq koaU ]
transliteration: Moust Juddh Joutte Bhat Dooo|| Teesar Taah(i) Na Pekheeat Kooo||
translation: The war with fists of both the warriors began and none other except those two could be seen in the battlefield.

gurmukhi: Bey duhn ky rwqy nYxw ] doKq dov qmwsy gYxw ]35]
transliteration: Bhae Duhan Ke Raate Nainaa|| Dekhat Dev Tamaase Gadnaa||35||
translation: The eyes of both had become red and all the groups of gods were seeing this performance form the sky.35.

gurmukhi: Ast idvs Asty inis ju`Dw ] kIno duhUM Btn imil kRu`Dw ]
transliteration: Ast Divas Aste Nis(i) Juddhaa|| Keeno Duhoon Bhatan Mil(i) Kruddhaa||
translation: For eight days and eight nights both these brave heroes, furiously, waged the dreadful war.

gurmukhi: bhuro Asur ikCuku murJwnw ] igrXo BUm jn biRC purwnw ]36]
transliteration: Bahuro Asur Kichhouk(u) Murjhaanaa|| Giryo Bhoom Jan Brichh Puraanaa||36||
translation: After this, the demon-king felt weakness and fell down on the earth like an old tree.36.
